page.title: 01Farnham to Brearton
page.content: An area of undulating landscape, mainly agricultural, with scattered copses, worked-outgravel and sandstone quarries, some light industry, and four villages. FARNHAM is picturesquely grouped around its ancient church. South of the village are flooded gravel pits, now being used for recreation, and an industrial unit. Nearby is the Mires, a Site of Special Scientific Interest. LINGERFIELD'S primary school serves the surrounding area. The village is an haphazard collection of houses and offices in a variety of materials. SCOTTON is the largest village; the only one with a shop. BREARTON has farms situated in the village. New houses are being constructed behind the old buildings.
